H0.text: What grammatical term, from Greek 'form', is a single indivisible part of a word having meaning or linguistic purpose. Morpheme

H1.text: What grammatical term, from Greek 'form', is a single indivisible part of a word having meaning or linguistic purpose. Phoneme

H2.text: What grammatical term, from Greek 'form', is a single indivisible part of a word having meaning or linguistic purpose. Grapheme

H3.text: What grammatical term, from Greek 'form', is a single indivisible part of a word having meaning or linguistic purpose. Moneme

A4.text: A morpheme is any of the smallest meaningful constituents within a linguistic expression and particularly within a word.

A5.text: The field of linguistic study dedicated to morphemes is called morphology.
